organic_results.title: Teacher unionization: A reassessment of rank and file motivations
organic_results.snippet: This research investigates factors underlying teacher support for the union movement in six New York school districts in the sixties. Feelings of powerlessness in educational decision making were an important motivating factor, a contrast with previous interpretations assuming only economic motivations. Sources of powerlessness include teachers' attitudes favoring autonomy and dissatisfaction with both administrative leadership and education programs in schools. Teachers reporting powerlessness showed higher rates of union …

publication_info.summary: DK Jessup - Sociology of Education, 1978 - JSTOR
